alert.note: Alert for Androscoggin; Central Interior Cumberland; Central Somerset; Coastal Cumberland; Interior Cumberland Highlands; Interior York; Kennebec; Lincoln; Northern Franklin; Northern Oxford; Sagadahoc; Southern Franklin; Southern Oxford; Southern Somerset (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 17 at 9:10AM EST by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...Thunderstorms will impact portions of Kennebec, north central York, central Oxford, Androscoggin, southwestern Somerset, northwestern Lincoln, Cumberland, Sagadahoc and Franklin Counties through 945 AM EST... At 907 AM EST, Doppler radar was tracking thunderstorms along a line extending from 12 miles west of Rangeley to near Hollis. Movement was east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Cloud to ground lighting is occurring. Locations impacted include... Lewiston, Brunswick, Augusta, Westbrook, Waterville, Bath, Farmington, Fairfield, Gardiner, Bridgton, Mechanic Falls, Bethel, Rangeley, Skowhegan, Naples, Oakland, Topsham, Rumford, Turner and Wiscasset. This includes the following highways... Interstate 295 between mile markers 19 and 51. Interstate 95 between mile markers 55 and 131. TIME...MOT...LOC 1407Z 255DEG 114KT 4500 7089 4361 7068 MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
